intro: Anarrhinum forskaohlii subsp. forskaohlii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial with a rosette growth habit, featuring succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that allows it to access groundwater. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used in local herbal remedies.
